name: places/ChIJYb8iUJVZwokRy3ukAyCGvHM
formattedAddress: 619 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 619 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014-1813, USA

originalText.text:
Went close to the closing time. Lady took the detergent from my hand went ahead and poured the entire thing without asking me (when I only wanted half).

Also told me to hurry up when I was picking up my clothes. Could have waited for 30 seconds before turning the lights off while I was still inside.

On the plus side, it is open later than the other laundromats. Will not be back.

originalText.text:
I've been using their wash and fold service regularly for about 6 months now. They have great hours, are very friendly, and the prices aren't bad. I've never had an issue with damage or staining.

Using their machines to do your own laundry is very expensive, but the wash and fold is reasonably priced.

You can drop your laundry off at 2 or 3 and they'll have it done the same day - it's great service.

originalText.text: I had laundry done here a few times. The first times, the experience was 3/5 - the pick up and delivery times were very inconsistent (e.g. delivery delayed by a day, late pick ups, etc.) and I was overcharged for cleaning of a fitted sheet as a blanket, but at least my clothes were clean. The latest time though, all my whites came back with brown streaks that could not be removed. I’m switching to a different laundromat from here on out.

originalText.text: Best laundromat & dry cleaner in town. I’ve been a regular customer, both for drop off and doing my own laundry, for decades. I’m happy to be back in the neighborhood and even happier to find that ABC is still around and with the amazing old crew of Carl, Myo, and Annie, best people ever, and best, most reliable and friendliest service!!! Some things should never change.

text.text: Best laundromat & dry cleaner in town. I’ve been a regular customer, both for drop off and doing my own laundry, for decades. I’m happy to be back in the neighborhood and even happier to find that ABC is still around and with the amazing old crew of Carl, Myo, and Annie, best people ever, and best, most reliable and friendliest service!!! Some things should never change.

originalText.text:
Pros:
- Friendly people who work there
- Good quality washers & driers

Cons:
- Expensive and just got more expensive--$5.00 for a small load, $8 for a large. I usually spend $18 altogether with dryers
- Small space can get a little cramped.

Other thoughts:
- I can't blame them too much for raising prices given that the business is trying to survive the global pandemic going on right now... but still, ~$20 every time I gotta do some laundry is pretty steep
- I've never used the drop off service so I can't speak to it. I think it'd effectively cost about the same and is definitely more convenient, but I prefer to do things on my own, ie use my own detergent/separate/dry at different cycles/etc.
